articles.title: When Vaccines Aren’t an Option: Life for Families With Children Under 12 - The New York Times
articles.description: About 48 million American children are not eligible for a coronavirus shot. Their parents face difficult choices as school starts.

articles.title: Japan princess to wed, reject payout after controversy: reports - The Star Online
articles.description: TOKYO (AFP): The course of true love never did run smooth, but after public controversy and a wedding delay, Japan's Princess Mako is reportedly set to tie the knot and move to America.

articles.title: U.S. COVID vaccination rates climb in August - Medical Xpress
articles.description: (HealthDay)—Nearly 14 million Americans got their first dose of a coronavirus vaccine in August, a steep rise from July, White House officials said Tuesday.
